bug.author: ghost(ghost)
bug.summary: Possible problem with window instructions for "Learning-Environment-Executable.md"
bug.description:
Please refer to: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/blob/master/docs/Learning-Environment-Executable.md>https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/blob/master/docs/Learning-Environment-Executable.md</denchmark-link>
"6. Click Build:
In the File dialog, navigate to your ML-Agents directory. Assign a file name and click Save. (For Windowsï¼‰With Unity 2018.1, it will ask you to select a folder instead of a file name. Create a subfolder within the ML-Agents folder and select that folder to build. In the following steps you will refer to this subfolder's name as env_name."
After following the instructions in bold, I received the following error: "UnityEditor.BuildPlayerWindow+BuildMethodException: Building to the Assets folder is not allowed." I tested creating the sub folder in the UnitySDK directory instead and it worked without a hitch. All the best, Parker
